game type: dexterity: These games require players to perform real world physical feats to win.
roleplaying: These games require players to act out and develop live characters.
worker placement: These games require players to assign limited numbers of workers to an array tasks in the hopes of outperforming their opponents.
area control: These games require players to defend and ultimately grow their territory.
legacy: These games evolve over a series of gaming sessions.
tower defense: These games require players to build a series of defenses for staving off waves of oncoming enemies.
key mechanic: asymmetric characters: Players have different assigned roles each with their own strengths and weaknesses.
battle royale: It's everyone for themselves and the last person standing wins.
blackbox: Key information is held in a sealed location, only to be revealed when the conditions are right.
fog of war: Location information is hidden from view until said location is explored.
perfect knowledge: All information about the game state is available at all times to all players.
kingmaking: Players no longer able to win can still influence the game's outcome.
